citeinfo.title: Lloyd's New Military Map of the Border & Southern States, 1861

descript.abstract: This is a scanned version of the 1861 paper map entitled: Lloyd's New Military Map of the Border & Southern States. The map was scanned at 300 dots per inch and is in the TIFF format.
descript.purpose: Scanned maps may be used for a variety of purposes. This image may be used in a GIS.
descript.supplinf: 1 map : col. ; 76 x 105 cm. Scale [ca.1:1,850,000]. Shows towns, railroads, rivers, names and boundaries of states. Covers some Middle Atlantic states: Pennsylvania, New York, New Jersey, Delaware, Maryland, Washington, D.C. Relief shown by hachures. Cf. LC Civil War Maps (2nd ed.), 12.5, 27, 38, 71 for similar printings ; this printing attested therein. Inset: [Map of southern Florida]. Includes list of references. Below head of title: Agents wanted to sell this and many other maps and charts for the times.

dataqual.logic: The raster image is a faithfully reproduced digital image of the original source map. Some differences may be detected between the source graphic used and the raster image due to the RGB values assigned that particular color. The intent is to recreate those colors as near as possible.
dataqual.complete: Data completeness for digitized paper map files reflect the content of the source graphic.
